total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the locations of the numbers 1, 3, 4, 6, and 7 in the input grid.
Q2: Determine the range of the 5s in the input grid.
Q3: Divide the range of 5s into sections based on the locations of the numbers identified in Q1.
Q4: Assign a new number to each section of 5s based on the numbers identified in Q1. The new number should be the same as the number that divides the section.
Q5: Replace the 5s in each section with the new number assigned in Q4.
Q1: Identify the locations of the numbers 1, 3, 4, 6, and 7 in the input grid.
Q2: Determine the range of the 5s in the input grid.
Q3: Identify the pattern of the transformation from the input grid to the output grid in the examples.
Q4: Apply the transformation pattern to the locations of the numbers 1, 3, 4, 6, and 7 in the input grid of the quiz.
Q5: Apply the transformation pattern to the range of the 5s in the input grid of the quiz.
Q6: Combine the transformed locations and range to generate the output grid for the quiz.
Q1: Identify the locations of the numbers 1, 3, 4, 6, and 7 in the input grid.
Q2: Identify the area filled with the number 5 in the input grid.
Q3: Determine the half point of the area filled with the number 5.
Q4: Replace the left half of the area filled with the number 5 with the number 1.
Q5: Replace the right half of the area filled with the number 5 with the number found in the top right corner of the input grid.
Q6: Replace the bottom half of the area filled with the number 5 with the number found in the bottom left corner of the input grid.
Q7: Replace the top half of the area filled with the number 5 with the number found in the top left corner of the input grid.
